group_1.textRight: Ah, Sayaka, good morning!
Huh...?@Sayaka!

group_1.textLeft: ...Huh?
Good morning, Madoka.

group_1.textRight: Good morning, Sayaka.

group_1.textLeft: Morning to you too, Homura.

group_1.textRight: S-Sayaka...?

group_1.textLeft: Hmmm?

group_1.textRight: Is there... something on your mind?
You've been spacing out since yesterday...
Did something happen?

group_1.textLeft: ...Yeah. The truth is...

group_1.textRight: A blue haregi...@That sounds perfect for you.

group_1.textLeft: It was really pretty!
I wish I could put it into words...

group_1.textRight: I wouldn't have guessed a store with a haregi @like that would be empty.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah...
I was the only one there.@Kinda weird when you think about it.

group_1.textRight: I think I know that store...

group_1.textLeft: Madoka, you know the place?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, they handle good merch,
but I've heard rumors about the owner @being very particular.

group_1.textLeft: Hmm?
Isn't being particular the reason why she handles @such good merch?

group_1.textRight: Um...
Apparently the owner chooses who she'll sell stuff to.
Like this one time, someone ordered a really pretty kimono,
But the owner wouldn't sell it @because the buyer was "unworthy".

group_1.textLeft: It's true that the owner was pretty intimidating...
But saying she rejects customers seems a bit too much...
Though it would explain why the place was empty.

group_1.textRight: What did you think when you actually met her?

group_1.textLeft: It's true that she was obstinate and stubborn...
but not as much as these stories make her sound.
I spent a long time yesterday looking at that haregi,
but she didn't chew me out or anything.

group_1.textRight: Maybe she'd have said something @if you actually tried to buy it.

group_1.textLeft: You might be right...
W-well, I don't even know if I'm buying it or not...

group_1.textRight: But if I were to see you in a haregi,
I'd be really happy!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, yeah.@Just don't get your hopes up, okay?
